excerpt: Built in 1916, the renovated neoclassical revival building offers original murals, exhibits & tours.
detail_description: The Utah State Capitol, built in 1916, is a stunning neoclassical revival building located just two miles from downtown Salt Lake City. Visitors can marvel at the architecture and explore the 320,000 square foot interior with original murals, exhibits, and guided or self-guided tours that delve into Utah's rich history and government. Situated near Ensign Peak, it offers easy access to outdoor activities like hiking in Memory Grove Park and exploring City Creek Canyon.
name: Utah State Capitol
address: 350 State St, Salt Lake City, UT 84114, USA

excerpt: University of Utah's botanical garden features nature trails, workshops & an outdoor concert series.
detail_description: Red Butte Garden and Arboretum, located on the University of Utah campus, is a sprawling 100-acre botanical garden nestled in the scenic Wasatch Mountains foothills. It boasts over 21 acres of meticulously maintained gardens, five miles of nature trails for hiking enthusiasts, and an impressive arboretum housing diverse horticultural collections. The garden is renowned for its stunning display of daffodils and springtime blooming bulbs.
name: Red Butte Garden and Arboretum
address: 300 Wakara Way, Salt Lake City, UT 84108, USA

excerpt: Modern venue with 10 galleries exploring earth science & Utah’s native cultures in a scenic locale.
detail_description: Located along the Bonneville Shoreline Trail, the Natural History Museum of Utah is a modern venue with 10 galleries that delve into earth science and Utah's native cultures. The museum offers absorbing exhibits on topics ranging from the state's biological diversity and geology to prehistory. Visitors can engage with hands-on displays that teach about sand dune formation and constructing earthquake-proof buildings.
name: Natural History Museum of Utah
address: 301 Wakara Way, Salt Lake City, UT 84108, USA

excerpt: Home to an aviary & museum, this serene landmark features a lake with ducks & paddle-boat rentals.
detail_description: Liberty Park, Salt Lake's oldest and once the largest park until the 1950s, spans 80 acres and offers a variety of attractions. Visitors can enjoy a serene lake with paddle-boat rentals, jogging paths, sports courts, picnic facilities, swimming pool, splash pad, and children's playgrounds. The park is also home to Tracy Aviary - America's oldest bird park with a diverse collection of winged creatures.
name: Liberty Park
address: 600 Harvey Milk Blvd, Salt Lake City, UT 84105, USA

excerpt: Modern, 42-acre zoo boasting hundreds of animals & tropical gardens, plus a train & carousel.
detail_description: Utah's Hogle Zoo, situated on a 42-acre site at the base of Emigration Canyon, is a family-friendly destination that has been captivating visitors since 1931. The zoo is home to over 1000 animals from more than 250 regions worldwide, including rare species like the white rhino and snow leopard.
name: Utah's Hogle Zoo
address: 2600 Sunnyside Ave S, Salt Lake City, UT 84108, USA

detail_description: Temple Square, located in Salt Lake City, is a 10-acre compound and the official headquarters of the Mormon Church. The area features impressive religious buildings such as the Salt Lake Temple with its soaring spires and statue of the angel Moroni, and the Tabernacle with its gilded 11,623-pipe organ and acoustically sensitive dome-shaped auditorium.
name: Temple Square
address: 50 North Temple, Salt Lake City, UT 84150, USA

excerpt: Living-history park featuring Mormon monument, train rides, petting zoo & Native American village.
detail_description: This Is The Place Heritage Park is a 1,600-acre living-history village in Salt Lake City that commemorates the spot where the first Mormon pioneers completed their long journey. The park features enthusiastic costumed actors during the summer months and a mix of original and replica buildings such as blacksmiths, tinsmiths, and a department store founded by Brigham Young. Visitors can explore over 50 historic homes and structures, including a Native American Village, Prospectors Pit, and various artisan shops.
name: This Is The Place Heritage Park
address: 2601 Sunnyside Ave S, Salt Lake City, UT 84108, USA

detail_description: Temple Square is a sprawling complex featuring a collection of historic structures such as The Salt Lake Temple, Salt Lake Tabernacle, and Assembly Hall chapel. In addition to these architectural marvels, the site also boasts beautifully landscaped gardens, visitor centers, museums, libraries, and pavilions for visitors to explore and enjoy.
name: Temple square
address: Leathers, Salt Lake City, UT 84111, USA

excerpt: Upmarket retailers & diverse, casual dining options in polished surrounds with a water fountain.
detail_description: City Creek Center is a premier shopping destination located near Temple Square in downtown Salt Lake. This mixed-use development offers an open-air shopping center, water fountains, residential and office buildings, and a variety of entertainment options. Visitors can enjoy free events such as fitness series, fish feeding, fountain shows, and community workshops.
name: City Creek Center
address: 50 S Main St, Salt Lake City, UT 84101, USA

excerpt: Modern venue with many galleries & a diverse collection spanning 5,000 years of global visual art.
detail_description: The Utah Museum of Fine Arts is a historic and contemporary art museum located in Salt Lake City, UT. The museum features an expansive collection spanning 5,000 years of global visual art, with a focus on locally and internationally relevant exhibits. Focusing on both ancient and modern works, the museum also offers educational programming for both adults and children.
name: Utah Museum of Fine Arts
address: 410 Campus Center Dr, Salt Lake City, UT 84112, USA

excerpt: State-of-the-art venue featuring 3-D IMAX films, laser light shows & exhibits about space & science.
detail_description: Nestled in The Gateway district of downtown Salt Lake City, the Clark Planetarium is a cutting-edge venue that offers an immersive experience in space and science. Boasting 10,000 square feet of space, this state-of-the-art facility features interactive exhibits, educational programs, and captivating shows at the Northrop Grumman 3D IMAX Theatre and Hansen Dome Theatre.
name: Clark Planetarium
address: 110 400 W, Salt Lake City, UT 84101, USA

excerpt: Liberty Park’s 9-acre aviary offers exhibits, shows & encounters where guests can view & feed birds.
detail_description: Tracy Aviary at Liberty Park is the oldest aviary in the nation, spanning 9 acres and housing over 400 birds from 135 different species. Nestled in a serene wooded setting, this family-friendly attraction offers interactive experiences such as free-flight bird shows, hand-feeding opportunities, guided tours with ornithology experts, and educational programs.
name: Tracy Aviary at Liberty Park
address: 589 E 1300 S, Salt Lake City, UT 84105, USA

excerpt: 1900s trolley barn turned upscale mall with chain stores & local boutiques, restaurants & a museum.
detail_description: Trolley Square, a historic shopping destination in Salt Lake City, was once a trolley barn from the 1900s. It has been transformed into an upscale mall featuring a mix of chain stores and local boutiques, as well as restaurants and even a museum. The shopping center houses over 45 retail spaces within its unique infrastructure that used to store street cars.
name: Trolley Square
address: 602 E 500 S, Salt Lake City, UT 84102, USA

excerpt: Massive manor housing paintings, photos, manuscripts & memorabilia from Utah's earliest founders.
detail_description: The Pioneer Memorial Museum is dedicated to the settlement of the first Mormon people in Utah. The museum contains written artifacts, information and data collections, and rich photos that illustrate the journey of the pioneers from arrival to established cities. Additionally, extensive memorabilia collections document the lives of early settlers.
name: Pioneer Memorial Museum
address: 300 N Main St, Salt Lake City, UT 84103, USA

excerpt: Modern art spot featuring works by local & national artists in paint, photographs, sculpture & more.
detail_description: The Utah Museum of Contemporary Art is a contemporary art museum in Salt Lake City, Utah. Local, national and international artists are regularly featured in its four gallery spaces. The Gallery Stroll on third Friday of every month is always a good time to visit for people who enjoy art.
name: Utah Museum of Contemporary Art
address: 20 S W Temple St, Salt Lake City, UT 84101, USA

excerpt: Science, technology & art museum featuring touring exhibits, activities & workshops, plus a cafe.
detail_description: The Leonardo, located in downtown Salt Lake City, is a museum that combines science, technology, and art. Inspired by the curiosity of Leonardo da Vinci, the museum offers family-friendly exhibits showcasing the intersection of STEM principles and creativity. Visitors can engage in maker challenges at Leonardo's Workshop and create Claymation films at Leonardo's Studio. The museum also serves as an event venue with 10 spaces available for various occasions, offering entertainment, catering, and planning services.
name: The Leonardo
address: 209 E 500 S, Salt Lake City, UT 84111, USA

excerpt: Social & welcome complex in a landmark former hotel with dining, theater & family genealogy center.
detail_description: The Joseph Smith Memorial Building, formerly known as the Hotel Utah, is a historic landmark in Salt Lake City. Constructed in 1909, it served as a prestigious hotel for over 75 years before being transformed into a social center honoring Joseph Smith. The building features stunning design elements such as intricate glasswork, grand staircases, and marble columns. Visitors can enjoy dining at the Garden Restaurant, Roof Restaurant, and Nauvoo Cafe while exploring the FamilySearch Center and Legacy Theater.
name: Joseph Smith Memorial Building
address: 15 E S Temple St, Salt Lake City, UT 84150, USA

excerpt: Serene space with monuments, fountains, creekside paths, an off-leash area & picnic tables.
detail_description: Memory Grove Park is a serene and historic space located near downtown Salt Lake City. The park features monuments, fountains, creekside paths, an off-leash area for dogs, and picnic tables. It serves as the gateway to the City Creek Canyon and offers a two-mile nature walk with uphill sections. Visitors can explore the rotunda with historic murals and a bronze statue of TV inventor Philo T. Farnsworth before entering the park filled with monuments to Utah's veterans.
name: Memory Grove Park
address: 300 N Canyon Rd, Salt Lake City, UT 84103, USA

excerpt: This sprawling green space with a pond lures locals for long walks, bike rides, basketball & soccer.
detail_description: Sugar House Park, a former site of the Utah State Prison, has been transformed into a sprawling green space with various amenities. The park offers a 1.38-mile road for walking, running, cycling, and roller-blading. Visitors can enjoy picnics near the duck-filled pond or explore Hidden Hollows' paths and native vegetation.
name: Sugar House Park
address: 1330 2100 S, Salt Lake City, UT 84106, USA

excerpt: Green space dedicated to goodwill between nations via floral displays, statues & riverside trails.
detail_description: The International Peace Gardens, located within Salt Lake City's Jordan Park, is an 11-acre public botanical garden facility dedicated to promoting goodwill between nations. Established in 1952, the gardens feature 28 nationality gardens representing countries from around the world. Visitors can explore floral displays, statues of world peace leaders, and riverside trails while pondering the spirit of world peace and brotherly love.
name: International Peace Gardens
address: 1160 Dalton Ave S, Salt Lake City, UT 84104, USA
